back_text: Deck Size: 30. Deckbuilding Options: Seeker cards ([seeker]) level 0-5, Neutral cards level 0-5, cards with "uses (secrets)" level 0-4, up to five other level 0 Mystic and/or Survivor cards ([mystic] and/or [survivor]). Deckbuilding Requirements (do not count toward deck size): Mysteries of Wonderland, Lost in Thought, 1 random basic weakness. Additional Restrictions: Alice cannot be used for the "Alice in Wonderland" campaign.
flavor: "I have experience dealing with these sorts of horrors."
name: Alice Liddell
text:
[reaction] When an investigator at your location would test with any skill: Use your base [intellect] for that skill instead (Limit once for each investigator per round).
[elder_sign] effect: +0. Choose and shuffle a card from your discard back into your deck. Any investigator at your location may use this effect instead of their own elder sign effect.

name: Mysteries of Wonderland
text:
Alice Liddell deck only.
[reaction]: After you spend a secret from an asset you control: Draw a card or heal 1 horror (choose one, Liumit once per round).
[fast] During a skill test you are preforming, take 1 horror and exhaust Mysteries of Wonderland: You get +X skill value for this test, where X is the highest number of sercrets on an asset you control (max +4).

name: Lost in Thought
text: Uses (0 secrets). If there are 4 or more secrets on Lost in Thought, discard it. Revelation - Put Lost in Thought into play in your threat area. Set your base [intellect] to X, where X is the number of secrets on Lost in Thought. Ignore any other game effect that would change your base [intellect]. [fast] Move 1 secret from an asset you control to Lost in Thought. Forced - At the end of the round, place 1 resource token on Lost in Thought from the token bank, as a secret.
